column4: i'am having problems with reading acces in some partitions, it give me: mount: could not find /dev/sbd5 in /etc/fstab/ or /etc/mtab.  Could someone give me a hint?
sounds like a usb drive or something?
were they added since you installed ubuntu, or during setup
can you mount the drive manually?
eg mount /dev/sdb5 /media/spare  (or some other empty folder)
when i open the mounted map i get:  could not open /media/spare
you need to create the directory first.  Where did you want to have it mounted anyway?
yeah, but you'll need a folder underneath media
fair enough, is the partition blank, or is there something on it already?
well, mkdir /media/stuff    then mount it with         mount /dev/sdb5 /media/stuff
the rights are far less then other drives though
i got it working now, thank you! :)   Is there a way to automount one or more partition from boot?
you can edit the fstab to mount the partition on boot
